did.unittitle: Clinton Mindil Collection on NYU Alumni in World War I
did.abstract: Clinton Mindil was commissioned with the task of compiling a list of those from New York University who had fought in World War I. The materials in this collection outline through correspondence the process of putting together such a War Record and also contains an edited manuscript of the compilation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection is comprised of one box of correspondence, from 1917 to 1936, concerning the creation and status of the Records of Alumni and Students who Served in the World War. The collection also holds the edited manuscript of the volume created in the 1920s and lists alphabetically all the NYU students, faculty, and alumni who served.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: After World War I, New York University created a compilation of names and short biographies of all the NYU students, alumni, and faculty who fought in the war. Clinton Mindil, a professor of English at NYU and in the Home Study Department at Columbia University, worked with the NYU Dean of Faculties, Marshall Snow, during the 1920s to put together a list with short biographical narratives of all the New York University students, alumni, and faculty involved in the war.
The War Record was intended for publication by the New York University Press but was never published.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The first folder of the collection is made up of correspondence which is organized chronologically. The War Record manuscript, contained in the second and third folders, is organized first by casualties, then alphabetically within University affiliation (council, faculty, and students are listed separately).
